session.description:
Ms Mazotte spoke about data literacy for the vulnerable youth, impact measuring, thinking about capacity building in a way everyone can understand and how skills can create impact at on communities.
She also explained that they are going through different frameworks that force us to reflect in skills so as to build capacity for open data, while needing to go further in order to fill the gaps in each framework, always dealing with open data.

Initially, the room was going to be split into three groups, but given the number of people attending they decided to keep the same table arrangement. They discussed the challenges of open data against capacity building and shared their experiences from specific sectors like private, governments or CSOs. The aim was to understand the skill gaps and to know their sector’s specific needs.

conference_notes: Finally, they encouraged people to share their experiences and asked whether they had gone through some specific training or methodology
name: Capacity Building
